member.name: T:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea
member.summary: Defines constants that represent areas in a control.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.CalendarBackground
member.summary: The specified point is part of the calendar's background.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.Date
member.summary: The specified point is on a date within the calendar. The property of is set to the date at the specified point.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.DayOfWeek
member.summary: The specified point is over a day abbreviation ("Fri", for example). The property of is set to the corresponding date in the leftmost column.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.MonthBackground
member.summary: The specified point is over the month's background. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.NextMonthButton
member.summary: The specified point is over the button at the upper-right corner of the control. If the user clicks here, the calendar scrolls its display to the next month or set of months. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month below the button.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.NextMonthDate
member.summary: The specified point is over a date from the next month (partially displayed at the end of the currently displayed month). If the user clicks here, the calendar scrolls its display to the next month. The property of is set to the date at the specified point.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.Nowhere
member.summary: The specified point is either not on the calendar control, or it is in an inactive portion of the control.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.PrevMonthButton
member.summary: The specified point is over the button at the upper-left corner of the control. If the user clicks here, the calendar scrolls its display to the previous month or set of months. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month below the button.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.PrevMonthDate
member.summary: The specified point is over a date from the previous month (partially displayed at the end of the currently displayed month). If the user clicks here, the calendar scrolls its display to the previous month. The property of is set to the date at the specified point.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.TitleBackground
member.summary: The specified point is over the background of a month's title. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.TitleMonth
member.summary: The specified point is in a month's title bar, over a month name. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.TitleYear
member.summary: The specified point is in a month's title bar, over the year value. The property of is set to the date corresponding to first day of the month.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.TodayLink
member.summary: The specified point is on the today link at the bottom of the calendar control.

member.name: F:Voroshkov.Calendar.HitArea.WeekNumbers
member.summary: NOT IMPLEMENTED IN THIS VERSION OF .

member.name: T:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar
member.summary: Represents an enhanced month calendar control. Alternative to control.

remarks.p: The VerticalCalendar control represents an alternative for standard control.
The VerticalCalendar control allows the user to select a date and time using a visual display. You can limit the date and times that can be selected by setting the and properties.
You can set the first displayed month using property.
You can add commented dates that may be colored to your preference using , and
You can change the look of the calendar portion of the control by setting multiple Color and Font properties.
The Font. property may be used for customizing the size of the control.

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.GetDisplayRange(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves date information that represents the low and high limits of the displayed dates of the control.
member.param: to retrieve only the dates that are fully contained in displayed months; otherwise,
member.returns: The begin and end dates of the displayed calendar.
member.remarks: The GetDisplayRange method returns a that contains the begin and end dates displayed in the current view of the control. You can modify the returned range based on the value you specify for the visible parameter. By specifying , you can retrieve all dates displayed on the control; specifying retrieves only those dates that are part of fully displayed months. Returned value doesn't depend on visible parameter when property set to .

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveAllAnnuallyBoldedDates
member.summary: Removes all the annual dates.

remarks.para: This method clears all dates from the array. To remove a single date from the annual dates, use the method.
You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveAllBoldedDates
member.summary: Removes all the exact dates.

remarks.para: This method clears all dates from the array. To remove a single date from the bolded dates, use the method.
You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveAllMonthlyBoldedDates
member.summary: Removes all the monthly dates.

remarks.para: This method clears all dates from the array. To remove a single date from the monthly dates, use the method.
You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveAnnuallyBoldedDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of annual dates.
member.param: The date to remove from the date list.
member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, then only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day and month are used. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveAnnualDate(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of annual dates.
member.param: The date to remove from the date list.
The comment of the date which should be removed from the date list.
member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once with the same comment in the date list, then only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day is used. Comment of the date to delete should be exactly the same as specified comment parameter. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveBoldedDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of exact dates.
member.param: The date to remove from the date list.
member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, then only the first date is removed. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of exact dates.

member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once with the same comment in the date list, then only the first date is removed. Comment of the date to delete should be exactly the same as specified comment parameter. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveMonthlyBoldedDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of monthly dates.
member.param: The date to remove from the date list.
member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, then only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day is used. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.name: M:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.RemoveMonthlyDate(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified date from the list of monthly dates.

The comment of the date which should be removed from the date list.
member.remarks: If the specified date occurs more than once with the same comment in the date list, then only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day is used. Comment of the date to delete should be exactly the same as specified comment parameter. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal. See also .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is automatically resized to display its entire contents.
member.value: if the calendar control adjusts its width to closely fit its contents; otherwise, . The default is
member.remarks: When this property is set to , the control's height and width are automatically adjusted to display the entire contents of the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the calendar control displays selected days (See ) using colors stored in and .

member.summary: Indicates the style of the selection range for the control.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.DimensionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows of months displayed.
member.value: value specifies the number of rows of months to display.
member.remarks: Total number of months displayed can't be greater than 24.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.DimensionWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns of months displayed.
member.value: value specifies the number of columns of months to display.
member.remarks: Total number of months displayed can't be greater than 24.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.CalendarDimensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns and rows of months displayed.
member.value: A with the number of columns and rows to use to display the calendar.
member.remarks: Only two calendar years can be displayed at a time, and the maximum number of months that can be displayed is 24. Valid combinations of columns and rows make a maximum product of 24.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the date of the first month in a calendar control.
member.value: A value identifying the exact month.
member.remarks: The value of this property should be within the limits of and . Only month and year parts of the date are meaningful

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.ShowAllWeekdayLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the calendar control displays weekday labels in front of each month shown.
member.remarks: When the property set to only one column of weekday labels displayed per month row. Otherwise weekday labels displayed before each month.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.SelectionRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a calendar control.
member.value: A with the start and end dates of the selected range.

remarks.para: You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either or
If the property value of the is greater than its property value, the dates are swapped; the EndDate property value becomes the starting date, and StartDate property value becomes the end date.
NOTE: Scrolling the calendar display when a range is selected can not cause unexpected results in contrast to control. The date range is fully preserved and will be displayed corectly.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.
member.value: A indicating the first date in the selection range (See property).

remarks.para: If you set to a date that is later than the current , then is automatically set equal to .
If you set a date in that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the property, the value of is adjusted: is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to .
remarks.note: MaxSelectionCount represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd. For example, if MaxSelectionCount is seven (the default), then SelectionStart and SelectionEnd can be no more than six days apart.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.
member.value: A indicating the last date in the selection range (See property).

remarks.para: If you set to a date that is earlier than the current , then is automatically set equal to .
If you set a date in that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the property, the value of is adjusted: is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to .
remarks.note: MaxSelectionCount represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd. For example, if MaxSelectionCount is seven (the default), then SelectionStart and SelectionEnd can be no more than six days apart.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the first day of the week as displayed in the calendar control.
member.value: One of the values. The default is .
member.remarks: Day.Default value represents the default first day of week depending on international settings of your computer. For example: "Monday" - for Russia, "Sunday" for US.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.ExactDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which exact dates are displayed with different color and font.
member.value: The array of objects. (See also .)

remarks.para: Using this property, you can assign an array of exact dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.
The same date may be stored in ExactDates multiple times. In this case comments for the date will be divided by "|" sign.

Dates stored in this property will appear in . The comment associated with date will appear as a tooltip (see ). ExactDates, AnnualDates and MonthlyDates may appear in bold font (see ) or may be not displayed at all (see ).

member.value: if the AnnualDates displayed; otherwise, . The default is .

The same date may be stored in AnnualDates multiple times. In this case comments for the date will be divided by "|" sign.

Dates stored in this property will appear in . The comment associated with date will appear as a tooltip (see ). ExactDates, AnnualDates and MonthlyDates may appear in bold font (see ) or may be not displayed at all (see ).

remarks.para: Using this property, you can assign an array of monthly dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.
The same date may be stored in MonthlyDates multiple times. In this case comments for the date will be divided by "|" sign.

Dates stored in this property will appear in . The comment associated with date will appear as a tooltip (see ). ExactDates, AnnualDates and MonthlyDates may appear in bold font (see ) or may be not displayed at all (see ).

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.ShowSpecialDates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the calendar control displays the special dates.

remarks.para: If property value is then the dates stored in ExactDates, AnnualDates and MonthlyDates are shown with appropriate colors, comments to them appear as tooltips when mouse is over the date.
If property value is then special dates shown as ordinary dates. No comments for them appear as tooltips.

member.value: One of the values. The default is .

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.TodayDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is used by as today's date.
member.value: A representing today's date. The default value is the current system date.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.TodayLocalizedString
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that represents the localized string value for "today" word.
member.value: A specifying "today" in any language.
member.remarks: The value of this property is displayed at the bottom of the control. (see ).

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.ScrollChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the scroll rate for a calendar control.
member.value: A positive number representing the current scroll rate in number of months moved.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.MaxSelectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a calendar control.
member.value: The maximum number of days that you can select. The default is 366.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.TitleFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font of the text displayed in the title of each month in the control.
member.value: The object to apply to the text displayed in the title of each month in the control.

remarks.note: Don't change the property of the TitleFont because this may lead to unhandled exceptions.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.MinDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowable date.
member.value: A representing the minimum allowable date. The default is 1 Feb, 0001.

remarks.note: User might experience problems with visual editing of this and other properties of the type. This is because the standard 's minimum allowable date is 01/01/1753. All the preceding dates can't be edited visually. Edit such dates manually as strings.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.MaxDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable date.
member.value: A representing the maximum allowable date. The default is 1 Nov, 9997.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.BoldedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which exact dates are displayed in different color and font.
member.value: The array of objects.
member.remarks:
This property is left only for compatibility with . You should use property instead.
Actually this property provides access to ExactDates but doesn't store its own array of dates. The date added to BoldedDates immediately appears in ExactDates but without any comment and vice versa. If date in BoldedDates deleted the appropriate date in ExactDates deleted regardless of comment existence.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.AnnuallyBoldedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which annual dates are displayed in different color and font.
member.value: The array of objects.
member.remarks:
This property is left only for compatibility with . You should use property instead.
Actually this property provides access to AnnualDates but doesn't store its own array of dates. The date added to AnnuallyBoldedDates immediately appears in AnnualDates but without any comment and vice versa. If date in AnnuallyBoldedDates deleted the appropriate date in AnnualDates deleted regardless of comment existence.

member.name: P:Voroshkov.Calendar.VerticalCalendar.MonthlyBoldedDates
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which monthly dates are displayed in different color and font.
member.value: The array of objects.
member.remarks:
This property is left only for compatibility with . You should use property instead.
Actually this property provides access to MonthlyDates but doesn't store its own array of dates. The date added to MonthlyBoldedDates immediately appears in MonthlyDates but without any comment and vice versa. If date in MonthlyBoldedDates deleted the appropriate date in MonthlyDates deleted regardless of comment existence.
